elements.title: Max Whitlock (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Max Whitlock (pictured) is the most successful gymnast on the pommel horse at the Olympics, with two golds and a bronze?

elements.title: ochrophyte (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that ochrophyte algae have twice as many membranes around their chloroplasts as plants?

elements.title: Josef Weiss (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that pianist and composer Josef Weiss created the first film score in the history of German cinema?

elements.title: the 2023 election for sheriff (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2023 election for sheriff in Caddo Parish, Louisiana, was rerun after an initial margin of one vote?

elements.title: Marcelino Gutiérrez (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Marcelino Gutiérrez was the only surviving brother who led the Gutiérrez Brothers' rebellion against Manuel Pardo, the elected president of Peru?

elements.title: a brand-new mansion in New York City (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the heiress Gertrude Rhinelander Waldo abandoned a brand-new mansion in New York City and refused to sell, rent, or maintain it?

elements.title: Bud Lea (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that even though he read the articles of sportswriter Bud Lea "religiously", Vince Lombardi often made his job difficult whenever he interviewed him?

elements.title: Pocinho railway station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Comboio Presidencial, a train that carried the Portuguese head of state through the Linha do Douro from 1890, had the Pocinho railway station as its last stop?

elements.title: Kully Thiarai (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Kully Thiarai made a theatre in Doncaster a "living room" for the town?
